DW (10/10/2001 10:04:39 AM)
	Following the smoke test, I got an NPE when attempting to open
	java.util.Vector in an editor, by double clicking it in the package navigator:
	NOTE the .class file had no attached source.


java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.JavaEditor.setSelection(JavaEditor.java:235)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.EditorUtility.revealInEditor(EditorUtility.java:110)

DW (10/10/2001 12:04:24 PM)
	In the following code, the expression "reference.getSourceRange()" returns null (in JavaEditor).

		try {
			// find this source reference in this editor's working copy
			reference= getJavaSourceReferenceAt(reference.getSourceRange().getOffset());
		} catch (JavaModelException x) {
			// be tolerant, just go with what is there
		}

DW (10/10/2001 12:06:53 PM)
	Moved to JUI.

AK (10/10/2001 7:09:33 PM)
	dup of 1GLBZFL: ITPJUI:WIN2000 - internal error in packages view

EG (10.10.2001 21:58:19)
	according the API contract getSourceRange() returns null when there is no 
	source attached. The editor should protect against this case.

I can still reproduce the problem in 204.
To reproduce:
1) start a workspace that is using the default JRE
2) create a new project
3) drill down into rt.jar
4) open some class file e.g. java.util.Vector.

Did the fix get lost somehow?
*** Bug 4935 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I see the fix is in 1.27 of JavaEditor
*** Bug 4958 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
